parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn to, commit, entrust; I allow, yield, permit. From epi and the base of trope; to turn over, i.e. Allow.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Unclean, impure. Impure (lewd) or specially, (demonic).
Wind, breath, spirit.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A swine, hog, sow. Of uncertain derivation; a hog.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A flock, herd. From ago; a drove.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Two thousand. From dis and chilioi; two thousand.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rush, hasten on. From horme; to start, spur or urge on, i.e. to dash or plunge.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A crag, precipice, steep bank. From kremannumi; overhanging, i.e. A precipice.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To choke, throttle, strangle; hence: I drown. Strengthened from pneo; to wheeze, i.e. to throttle or strangle.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
